byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and Michael Barbaro from New York. Jesse Coburn contributed reporting from Berlin.
byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and MICHAEL BARBARO

abstract: Residents of German capital of Berlin express reservations about presidential hopeful Jeb Bush, who is set to visit city as part of upcoming European tour; many German citizens dislike his brother former Pres George W Bush for engineering America's second war in Iraq, but sentiment is more positive toward his father former Pres George Bush, who worked to reunite country after fall of Berlin Wall.
lead_paragraph: Residents of the German capital express unease over the last name of the former Florida governor, who is expected to declare his presidential candidacy.

headline.main: Berlin, Leery of One Bush, Prepares to Meet Jeb
headline.print_headline: Leery of One Bush, Berlin Awaits Another

snippet: Residents of the German capital express unease over the last name of the former Florida governor, who is expected to declare his presidential candidacy.
